page.title: 15HORTICULTURE IN RODNEY STOKE
page.content: The south facing footslope of the Mendip Hills is well-known for {intensive agriculture.}Brangay Farm near Rodney Stoke is a holding of 8.3 hectares which specialises in growing strawberries,iceberg lettuce,radish and salad onions.Seeds and plants are purchased from specialist suppliers. Iceberg lettuce plants come from Evesham and radish seed comes from France for early varieties and England for main crop varieties.Strawberries are cropped from mid May to mid July; Iceberg lettuce from June to November and and salad onions from mid-April to mid-October.The land is Agriculture Grade 2 land and includes 3 soil types with average pH between 5.5 and 6.5. The land is irrigated from boreholes.
